name: Scrambled Eggs with Chicken Livers
keywords: chicken liver, dry vermouth, eggs, main course
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup grated Parmesan or other hard cheese
6 fresh sage leaves, or a teaspoon minced rosemary or thyme

recipeInstructions.text: Put 3 tablespoons of the oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat; a minute later, add the onion and cook, stirring, until it begins to brown, about 5 minutes. Meanwhile, beat the eggs with about half the cheese and some salt and pepper.

Add the sage and livers to the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until pink, about 3 minutes. Pour in the eggs and vermouth and stir until the eggs set, a minute or so. Garnish with the remaining olive oil and Parmesan and serve hot, warm, or at room temperature.

video.name: Eggs With Chicken Livers
video.description: The chef Frank De Carlo of Peasant shows Mark Bittman how to make a simple, flavorful, funky dish for the cold weather.
